title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should give error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: When a Java file is already opened in the workbench and an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor, nothing happens.
EB: However, there should be a warning message or an error message displayed when attempting to open a file that is already opened in another editor.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 

1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or NotePad as the default editor for all Java files. 
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it. 
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench. 
4. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 

Expected Behavior: A warning message should be displayed in the workbench informing the user that making changes to the file may overwrite previous changes. The message should also ask if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, prompting the user to close all other instances of the file.
